summary: An email dated August 12, 2019, from a Regional Director of the Northeast Region, reporting the number of overtime occurrences (not hours) for staff between August 3 and August 10, 2019. The document appears to be internal administrative correspondence, possibly from a detention or correctional facility, given the context of the Epstein case and his death in custody on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Regional Director Northeast Region
persons.context: Sender of an email reporting overtime occurrences for staff between August 3 and August 10, 2019.

events.title: High Overtime Occurrences
events.description: 35 overtime occurrences were reported for staff on this date, the highest in the reported period.

events.title: Overtime Reporting Period
events.description: A period during which daily overtime occurrences for staff were tracked and reported, ranging from 22 to 35 occurrences per day.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated August 12, 2019, reporting staff overtime occurrences from August 3 to August 10, 2019.
Overtime occurrences peaked at 35 on August 10, 2019, the date Jeffrey Epstein died in custody.
The report specifies these are 'occurrences' (counts of overtime events), not total hours worked.
The sender is identified only by the title 'Regional Director Northeast Region', with no personal name provided.
The document's administrative nature and timing suggest it may relate to staffing or security operations at a facility where Epstein was held.
